sn42.7:2.6: In the context of renunciate life, brahmacariya implies “celibacy” (DN 1:1.8.5), the explanation being that Brahmā, as a being created by the practice of absorption, is beyond sensual desires. In the Brahmanical system, it referred to the period of study of a chaste young man under a teacher before marriage. Here, however, we see that it is used of layfolk in a more general sense of “spiritual practice” or “divine conduct”.
sn42.7:4.6: Here and below read tesaṁ pāhaṁ for text’s tesāhaṁ.
